item.title: Autocad-5 : 7 Dimension tricks you need to know about.
item.author: michtintin
item.description: 7 Dimension tricks you need to know about. Introduction. 00:00-00:49:08 Hi, How’s it going? Today I’ll be showing you how to do Dimension using shortcuts. So I have a row of boxes here to dimension Usually beginners will dimension this way. You’ll go and click dimension and then turning on Object Snap, you will click each point one by one, making sure that they are aligned, and this is really time consuming.

item.title: Autocad-4: Trace with Autocad. FAST, CLEAN & with LOW ANCHOR POINTS.
item.author: michtintin
item.description: Plotting precise boundary line using survey coordinates. Introduction. 00:00-00:0 Hi Everyone. In this video I’m going to show you how to import an image into AutoCAD and vectorise it and export it into illustrator. Convert it into editable path in Illustrator. Import an image and fade it. 00:18-00:59 So first of all, let’s import an image or sketch into AutoCAD. We pick our drawing. JPEG or PNG is fine or even PDF would be okay.

item.title: Autocad-3 : Plotting precise boundary line using survey coordinates.
item.author: michtintin

item.title: Autocad-2: Rotating and scaling a scanned layout plan with a reference line; using a carpark lot.
item.author: michtintin
item.description: Align & Scale Shortcut using coordinates for accuracy. 00:00-00:17 Introduction Hi Everyone! Today I will be showing you how to scale a drawing with a carpark lot on the plan. A carpark lot is 2.4 meters by 5.8 meters, so if you have a scanned plan which is out of scale, you can use this method to scale it. 00:18-1:20 Draw one side of a carpark lot to scale of 1:1.

item.title: Autocad-1 : Align & Scale Shortcut using coordinates for accuracy.
item.author: michtintin
item.description: Align & Scale Shortcut using coordinates for accuracy. 00:00-00:09 Introduction Hello, everyone. This video is about how to Scale and Align your drawing if you only have two coordinates. 00:10-00:16 Check default units. Check that the units are all in millimetres, or type “UNITS”, spacebar. 00:17-00:27 Attach reference image plan. Bring in the drawing with Reference Manager, “REF” spacebar. and then click attach and select your drawing. Check that the unit is in millimetres and then click OK
